title: SOS! ORA L’ALGORITMO PUNTA SUI ‘COMPLOTTISTI’: “INTERVENIRE SUBITO!” - ByoBlu
Secondo uno studio dell'università di Urbino l'algoritmo di Facebook ora punisce la politica ufficiale e premia gli estremisti antieuropei. Pd e FdI verso una legge bipartisan sulle piattaforme
snippet: The article discusses a study published by the University of Urbino, authored by Professor Fabio Giglietto, which analyzes the effects of Meta's algorithmic choices on the distribution and visibility of political content on Facebook. The study highlights that the algorithmic suppression appears less effective against extremist actors. The research analyzed over 2.5 million posts on Facebook between 2021 and 2025.
description: The article discusses a study by Professor Fabio Giglietto from the University of Urbino, which analyzes how Facebook's algorithm affects the visibility of political content, particularly regarding extremist actors.

title: MENO POLITICA SU META, ESTREMISTI IN VANTAGGIO - 9Colonne
Il Premio Rimini Mundi a sette ambasciatori del congressuale - lapiazzarimini.it
Advancing Research on Disinformation and Digital Manipulation: The University of Urbino at two Key Conferences in Brazil – vera.ai VERification Assisted by Artificial Intelligence
snippet: Reports on Professor Fabio Giglietto's presentation of collaborative research using large language models (LLMs) to analyze political discourse in hyperpartisan Facebook groups, and moderating a roundtable discussion on data access in the DSA era at conferences in Brazil.
description: This article from vera.ai reports on Professor Fabio Giglietto's participation in conferences in Brazil, where he presented research on using LLMs for analyzing political discourse and moderated a discussion on data access in the DSA era.

title: Il movimento religioso cinese che si è infiltrato in un gruppo Facebook urbinate - il Ducato
Meta Is Getting Rid of CrowdTangle—and Its Replacement Isn't as Transparent or Accessible
snippet: Fabio Giglietto, an associate professor of internet studies at the University of Urbino, is quoted as an early tester of Meta's MCL (Meta Content Library), expressing concerns about its limits compared to CrowdTangle, especially regarding data exporting for disinformation research projects like Vera AI EU.
description: The article discusses Meta's decision to replace CrowdTangle with MCL, and quotes Fabio Giglietto, an associate professor of internet studies at the University of Urbino, regarding his concerns about the limitations of MCL for disinformation research.
